intro: Pulsatilla austriaca, commonly known as the Austrian pasqueflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant features a short, thick rhizome and hairy stems that bear palmate, lobed leaves. Its flowers have five to seven sepals that resemble petals, and it produces follicles containing numerous seeds. Pulsatilla austriaca thrives in well-drained, calcareous soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine regions.
